para.text: This software is a spin-off of a Proof of Concept for drawing normal bitmaps on the maps in Smallworld GIS. The investigation revealed easy use of bitmap resources with transparency, mainly caused by the new alpha property of the object 'colour'.
The use of grids and colour mappings for value mapping was a logical start, and is still part of the module set.

The Configuration GUI is written as subclass of model, the plugin has actions and a toolbar. It seems to be very logical to build the GUI in the Style Designer application. There is no database involved, except for the tab RWO mappings, which interacts with the style view.
The GUI is mainly based on legacy widgets, but all of them function as designed.
Although the software is initially developed on 4.3.0, it will work only in Smallworld 5. The latest test is done on 5.2.2.
The software is public domain, with courtesy of Realworld Software Products.
